document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Cladiscus (Coleoptera: Cleridae) from Japan and Taiwan, with descriptions of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Cladiscus (Coleoptera: Cleridae) from Japan and Taiwan, with descriptions of two new species

bibRefCitation.author: Lewis
bibRefCitation.refString: LEWIS C. 1892: On the Japanese Cleridae. Annals and Magazine of Natural History 1 F (W): 183 - 192.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cladiscus obeliscus Lewis, 1892: 185
[original description]. LOΗDΕ (1900): 16 [listed]; CORΗΑΜ (1903): 332 [noted, faunistics]; S CΗΕΝΚLΙΝG (1906): 247 [noted]; S CΗΕΝΚLΙΝG (1910): 9 [listed]; CORΡORΑΑL +|VΑΝ DΕR WΙΕL (1949): 197 [key to species]; CORΡORΑΑL (1950):22 [listed]; NΑΚΑΝΕ (1963):182 [noted,incl.pl.91, figs 22a,b]; MΙYΑΤΑΚΕ (1985): 152 [noted, incl. pl. 24, fig. 20].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cymatodera strangulata Kiesenwetter, 1879
(nec Chevrolat, 1843 ): 314 [original description]. LΕ WΙS (1895): 122 [synonymized].

Type locality.
Japan , Honshu and Kyushu (after LΕ WΙS 1892).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Supplementary description. Male
( Fig. 1 ). Head, antennomeres III to XI, elytra and legs brownish black; antennomeres I and II, pronotum brownish red; pronotum sometimes largely brownish black.
Female. Similar to male, but EyD/EyW 3.18–4.63 (3.57); antennae ( Fig. 15 ) relatively shorter; apical margin of abdominal ventrite V truncated broadly and deeply in middle.

caption.paragraph:
Figs 27–39. Male protibiae (27–33) and prothorax in ventral view (34–39). 27, 34 –
Cladiscus obeliscus Lewis, 1892
; 28, 35 –
C. weyersi Kraatz, 1899
; 29, 36 –
C. sauteri Schenkling, 1912
; 30, 37 –
C. terminalis Schenkling, 1912
; 31, 38 –
C. pallidicornis Corporaal & van der Wiel, 1949
; 32, 39 –
C. hachijoensis
sp. nov. ; 33 –
C. liaoi
sp. nov. Scale bars: 0.5 mm.

Figs 40–51. Metendosternite, terminal parts and genitalia of
Cladiscus obeliscus Lewis, 1892
(40–43, 46–48, male; 44, 45, 49–51, female). 40 – metendosternite; 41, 44 – pygidium; 42, 45 – ventrite VI; 43 – spicular fork; 46–48 – male genitalia in lateral (46), ventral (47), and dorsal (48) views; 49–51 – apices of ovipositor in lateral (49), ventral (50), and dorsal (51) views.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution ( Fig. 126 ). Japan : Hokkaidô , Honshû, Shikoku, Kyushu, Nakano-shima, Tanega-shima (new record); Taiwan (new record); India (CORΗΑΜ 1903).

Remarks. This species was recorded from the southeastern islands of Japan , Amami-Oshima and Ishigaki-jima (NΑΚΑΜURΑ 1986), Iriomote-jima (T SUCΗΙDΑ +| SΑΚΑΙ 2015), Sonaguni-jima (I CΗΙΚΑWΑ 2008). Considering the similarity between this species and
C . pallidicornis
, all previous records need to be reviewed in the future and are not considered for the distribution data in this paper.
